metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20482 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: GNU Tar through 1.30, when --sparse is used, mishandles file shrinkage during read access, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (infinite read loop in sparse_dump_region in sparse.c) by modifying a file that is supposed to be archived by a different user's process (e.g., a system backup running as root).

criterions.comment: tar: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
